headline: House Republican leader Kevin McCarthy backs primary challenger to Rep. Liz Cheney in Wyoming
author: Associated Press
sentences:
Key Words (February 2021): Don't read much into the awkward moment when McCarthy and Cheney were asked about Trump's ongoing influence, says former tea-party congressman
Also see: A defining moment': Kinzinger says Republican National Committee censure of him and Cheney shows McCarthy's weakness as House leader
Cheney broke with the GOP leader, and most of her Republican colleagues, as they quickly resumed their collective embrace Trump after the Jan. 6 insurrection, when a mob of his supporters stormed the Capitol to prevent Congress from affirming Joe Biden's election victory.

As McCarthy weighs in, the GOP leader's fundraising skills are perhaps an even bigger draw than his name, an ability to lend the kind of hefty campaign support to Hageman that will be needed to counter Cheney's own political strength as a nationally known political figure.

Associated Press
A Cheney spokesperson was dismissive of the importance of McCarthy's endorsement of Cheyenne lawyer Harriet Hageman: Wow, [Hageman] must be really desperate'
WASHINGTON (AP)  House Republican leader Kevin McCarthy late this week endorsed a primary challenger to Rep. Liz Cheney, a remarkable step for a party leader that effectively lends his weight to the effort to purge a chief critic of former President Donald Trump's from Congress.

McCarthy said he was shocked? that Cheney would join the committee and later called her a Pelosi Republican.?
Cheney said that at every opportunity, the minority leader has attempted to prevent the American people from understanding what happened  to block this investigation.?
This year, the committee asked McCarthy to provide information about his conversations with Trump and White House officials before, during and after? the riot.

Under the bill, voters would not be allowed to change their party affiliation in the 96 days leading up to the Republican and Democratic primaries, which are set for Aug. 16.
It makes total sense that only Democrats vote in the Democrat primary and only Republicans vote in the Republican primary,? Trump said in a statement Thursday endorsing the proposed change.

Wyoming lawmakers voted narrowly Thursday to consider a bill that would, in theory, make it harder for Democrats to change their voter registration to Republican to boost Cheney in this summer's primary.

In a statement expressing appreciation for McCarthy's support, Hageman said Cheney was actively damaging the Republican Party.?
The Democrats in Washington, D.C. only see her as a temporary but useful tool to achieve their partisan goals, and the Republicans want nothing to do with her,? Hageman said.

Fellow intraparty Trump critic Rep. Adam Kinzinger's political action committee has advocated such a strategy: effectively creating an uneasy? but temporary alliance to thwart the most Trumpist candidates and boost traditional Republicans in contested primaries.

Trump's influence can be seen across the race  one of his former top aides, Tim Murtaugh, is handling communications for Hageman, a Cheyenne attorney, and Trump supports changes to state election laws that could help his preferred candidate and hurt Cheney.

MarketWatch contributed.

Hageman had been an early supporter of Cheney's earlier campaigns but announced her bid to unseat the congresswoman largely for her vote to impeach Trump over his role in inciting the Jan. 6 insurrection.

The GOP House leader is determined to win back control of the chamber in this fall's midterm elections, and he sees that mission as running through Trump, who remains the undisputed leader of the party.
Trump's endorsement of candidates running in conservative House districts is crucial because of the hold he has over the Republican Party faithful, who tend to dominate voting in primary contests.
McCarthy's backing of Harriet Hageman for the at-large seat in Wyoming is certain to please Trump, who wants to rid the party of Cheney and others critical of his tenure.
In July, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi chose Cheney and fellow Trump critic Kinzinger, from Illinois, to sit on the Democratic-led panel investigating the insurrection.
The high-profile move from McCarthy, a Republican from south-central California, is an early sign of the tumultuous midterm elections that lie ahead for the GOP.
3 House Republican and a member of McCarthy's leadership team until her ouster and replacement by a more Trump-pliant Elise Stefanik nearly a year ago.
Wyoming is heavily Republican, meaning it would be unlikely that a Democrat could beat the winner of the GOP primary in a general election.
She was among 10 House Republicans who voted to impeach Trump over the insurrection and increasingly spoke out against him and the attack.
Cheney is the vice chair of the congressional panel investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, insurrection at the Capitol.
A Cheney spokesperson was dismissive of the importance of McCarthy's endorsement of Hageman.
It's unclear what, if any, weight McCarthy's support would carry in Wyoming.
Wow, she must be really desperate,? Jeremy Adler said.
It's all the more stunning because Cheney was the No.
Trump endorsed Hageman last year.
